participant_1.background:
I love my family, even though they are a little bit crazy.
i went to stanford.
I went to the beach and ate a lot of watermelon.
My favorite TV shows are ones that make me laugh and forget about my troubles.
My family is important to me, but my job is demanding and I don't always get to see them as much as I would like.

participant_2.background:
I treasure my collection of vintage horror movies, which I love to watch with my grandchildren.
i love to go outside at night and eavesdrop on my neighbors arguments.
i like fitness.
I love adrenaline rushes and pushing myself to the limit.
i moved to ny to study in a prestigious designing school.

content.text: What's up?
Hey, not much. What about you?
I'm good. Just finished watching my favorite show.
Oh, what is it about?
It's about a group of friends who solve mysteries.
Sounds interesting. I'm not much of a TV person, but I do love mysteries.
Yeah, it's a lot of fun. I'm usually not one for mysteries either, but this one is really good.
What's it called? Maybe I'll check it out.
It's called "Stranger Things."
Oh yeah, I've heard of that one. I've heard good things about it.
It's really good. You should definitely check it out.
I will. Thanks for the recommendation.
No problem. So, what do you do for fun?
I like to go to the gym, watch horror movies, and go out with my friends.
Oh, I love horror movies too. What are some of your favorites?
I like all of the classic horror movies, like "The Shining" and "The Exorcist."
Me too! I love those movies.
I also like some of the newer horror movies, like "The Conjuring" and "The Babadook."
I haven't seen those yet. I'll have to check them out.
You should. They're really good.
Sounds like we have a lot in common.
Yeah, it looks like we do.
We should hang out sometime.
That would be fun. I'll bring my copy of "Stranger Things."
Sounds good. I'll bring some popcorn
